intro: Tylecodon sulphureus var. sulphureus, commonly known as the yellow moonveld succulent, is a member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that are covered in a fine, yellowish to orange-colored bloom. Its leaves are typically small, pale green, and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. This species is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental appearance and low maintenance requirements.
